characterEvents.text: {ruler} and {spouse} have been blessed with a child, {child}!
{ruler} has fallen gravely ill. The court prays for recovery.
{ruler} has recovered from illness! The realm celebrates.
An assassination attempt on {ruler}! The spymaster investigates.
{ruler} has developed a reputation as {trait}.
Scandal! The {advisorRole} of {kingdom} has been caught in corruption.
{kingdom} proposes a marriage alliance between {char1} and {char2}.
With no clear heir, {kingdom} faces a succession crisis!
{ruler} hosts a grand feast, improving relations with neighboring rulers.
A grand tournament is held in {kingdom}! Knights from across the realm compete.
The {advisorRole} of {kingdom} has been secretly working for a rival kingdom!
A bitter feud erupts within the {dynasty} dynasty over inheritance rights.
Young {child} of {kingdom} shows exceptional talent, impressing the court.
{heir} of {kingdom} celebrates a royal wedding with {spouse}.
A terrible plague sweeps through {kingdom}! The court physician works tirelessly.
A devastating flood has struck {kingdom}, destroying farmland and displacing villagers.
A bountiful harvest fills the granaries of {kingdom}! The people celebrate.
A golden age of art and learning blossoms in {kingdom} under {ruler}'s patronage.
{ruler} claims to have received a divine vision, inspiring the faithful.
Merchants flock to {kingdom} as trade routes expand. Gold flows freely.
Bandits have overrun the roads of {kingdom}! Traders fear for their lives.
A diplomatic envoy from {kingdom} was insulted at a foreign court. Tensions rise.
An ancient holy relic has been unearthed in {kingdom}! Pilgrims arrive in droves.
Whispers and plots fill the court of {kingdom}. Who can be trusted?
An explorer returns to {kingdom} with tales of distant lands and strange peoples.
A long drought grips {kingdom}. Crops wither and wells run dry.
A great comet blazes across the sky above {kingdom}. The people take it as an omen.
A child of extraordinary gifts is born in {kingdom}. Scholars marvel at their potential.
Discontent simmers in the provinces of {kingdom}. A rebellion may be brewing.

manifest_destiny.name: Manifest Destiny

meta.description: Inner map renderer configuration ‚Äî sprite sheet paths, overlay mappings, building mappings, fallback data

overlayMap._note: Maps sub-terrain IDs to overlay categories for the object layer

buildingToLPC._note: Maps building type keys to LPC structure sheet keys

spritePathToLPC._note: Maps hex sprite path substrings to LPC sheet keys (for buildings placed as sprite paths by innerMap.js)

actionDefs._note: Context menu action definitions ‚Äî label, icon, description

seek_audience.label: Seek Audience
seek_audience.desc: Request an audience with the lord

innerMapRenderer._note_characters: LPC character presets ‚Äî each defines compositing layers drawn bottom-to-top. Paths are relative to assets/lpc/Characters/. Walk.png and Idle.png are appended automatically.

npcAppearanceMap._note: Maps NPC type keys to arrays of valid character preset IDs. NPC picks one by seeded index.

ironborn.name: Ironborn
ironborn.ancestralMemory: The Ironborn remember the First Forge, deep in the Ashpeak mountains, where their ancestors tamed fire and steel.

crownlanders.name: Crownlanders
crownlanders.proverb: "A crown is earned at the table, not the battlefield."
crownlanders.ancestralMemory: The Crownlanders trace their line to the River Council, where seven chieftains broke bread and swore the First Compact.

shieldfolk.name: Shieldfolk
shieldfolk.ancestralMemory: The Shieldfolk were born from the Wardens who stood against the Shadow Tide, holding the passes when all seemed lost.

mosswalkers.name: Mosswalkers
mosswalkers.proverb: "The forest speaks to those who learn to be still."
mosswalkers.ancestralMemory: The Mosswalkers believe they were the first to hear the Heartwood sing ‚Äî the deep vibration of the oldest tree in creation.

canopiers.name: Canopiers
canopiers.proverb: "Those who fear falling never learn to fly."
canopiers.ancestralMemory: The Canopiers say their first mother climbed the World-Tree and never came down, building the first sky-village among its branches.

rootkeepers.name: Rootkeepers
rootkeepers.proverb: "Every oak was once an acorn with the courage to grow."
rootkeepers.ancestralMemory: The Rootkeepers guard the Seed Vaults ‚Äî ancient caches of every plant that ever lived, hidden in root caverns.

windrunners.name: Windrunners
windrunners.proverb: "A Windrunner tied down is a Windrunner already dead."
windrunners.ancestralMemory: They say the first Windrunner caught the tail of a cyclone and rode it across the steppe, mapping every horizon.

sandshapers.name: Sandshapers
sandshapers.proverb: "The desert gives nothing freely ‚Äî and teaches everything."
sandshapers.ancestralMemory: The Sandshapers remember the Year of Glass, when lightning struck the great dunes and their ancestors forged the first desert-glass mirrors.

bonecarvers.name: Bonecarvers
bonecarvers.proverb: "Honor the beast, and its spirit will run with you forever."
bonecarvers.ancestralMemory: The Bonecarvers carry the Great Tusk ‚Äî a mammoth bone inscribed with the names of every tribe elder for a thousand years.

sunweavers.name: Sunweavers
sunweavers.proverb: "Every dawn is proof that darkness cannot last."
sunweavers.ancestralMemory: The Sunweavers tell of a time when the sun died for three days, and their ancestor wove a cloth of pure light to call it back.

ashpilgrims.name: Ashpilgrims
ashpilgrims.ancestralMemory: The Ashpilgrims were born when a volcano buried their village. The survivors walked through the ash for forty days and emerged enlightened.

starcallers.name: Starcallers
starcallers.proverb: "We are all stardust, remembering where we came from."
starcallers.ancestralMemory: The Starcallers claim their founder once climbed a tower so high she touched the stars and brought back a fragment of cosmic truth.

tidecallers.name: Tidecallers
tidecallers.proverb: "The tide waits for no one, but rewards those who know its rhythm."
tidecallers.ancestralMemory: The Tidecallers built the first sea-wall ‚Äî a living barrier of coral and stone that protected their village from the Great Tsunami.

deepdivers.name: Deepdivers
deepdivers.proverb: "The greatest treasures are found where others fear to go."
deepdivers.ancestralMemory: The Deepdivers discovered the Sunken City ‚Äî an ancient civilization beneath the waves ‚Äî and traded its secrets for generations.

sailweavers.name: Sailweavers
sailweavers.proverb: "A good ship and a fair wind ‚Äî what more could the heart desire?"
sailweavers.ancestralMemory: The Sailweavers built the Eternal Fleet ‚Äî ships so masterfully crafted that some still sail, crewed by the descendants of their original builders.

lorekeepers.name: Lorekeepers
lorekeepers.proverb: "A people without records are a people without roots."
lorekeepers.ancestralMemory: The Lorekeepers descend from the Archivists of the Sunken Library, who saved ten thousand scrolls from the Great Flood by carrying them on their backs across the mountains.

thornwardens.name: Thornwardens
thornwardens.proverb: "Beauty and pain grow from the same stem."
thornwardens.ancestralMemory: The Thornwardens grew the Great Briar Wall ‚Äî a living barrier of thorns a hundred feet high ‚Äî that held back an invading army for a generation.

frostborn.name: Frostborn
frostborn.proverb: "The cold does not care. And neither shall we."
frostborn.ancestralMemory: The Frostborn survived the Long Winter ‚Äî seven years of endless snow ‚Äî by building cities inside glaciers and learning to farm the frost itself.

icewalkers.name: Icewalkers
icewalkers.proverb: "Walk softly on the ice, for the world is thin beneath us."
icewalkers.ancestralMemory: The Icewalkers once followed a white elk across a frozen ocean for forty days, discovering a hidden land of hot springs where they built their sacred winter refuge.

aurorans.name: Aurorans
aurorans.proverb: "The lights above are the dreams of the earth."
aurorans.ancestralMemory: The Aurorans believe their ancestors once spoke with the aurora itself, learning the language of light, and that each color carries a different truth.

deepdelvers.name: Deepdelvers
deepdelvers.proverb: "Dig deep enough and you will find the bones of the world."
deepdelvers.ancestralMemory: The Deepdelvers carved the Underhall ‚Äî a cathedral-sized cavern deep beneath the mountains ‚Äî where every surface glitters with embedded gems left by ancient rivers.

glowkin.name: Glowkin
glowkin.proverb: "In the deepest dark, we became our own light."
glowkin.ancestralMemory: The Glowkin were once surface dwellers who fled a great catastrophe underground, and over generations learned to cultivate the living lights of the deep caves.

crystalsmiths.name: Crystalsmiths
crystalsmiths.proverb: "Perfection is not achieved ‚Äî it is revealed, facet by facet."
crystalsmiths.ancestralMemory: The Crystalsmiths discovered the Singing Cavern ‚Äî a place where crystals of impossible size hum in perfect harmony, said to be the heartbeat of the world itself.

runespeakers.name: Runespeakers
runespeakers.proverb: "Every word carved in stone outlasts the hand that carved it."
runespeakers.ancestralMemory: The Runespeakers claim their founder discovered the First Rune ‚Äî a symbol of such power it split a mountain in two ‚Äî and swore to guard it and all runes that followed.

veilwalkers.name: Veilwalkers
veilwalkers.proverb: "The veil is thin for those with eyes to see."
veilwalkers.ancestralMemory: The Veilwalkers arose at a place where the world is thin ‚Äî a misty bog where the living and the dead can speak. They serve as intermediaries between realms.

dreamweavers.name: Dreamweavers
dreamweavers.proverb: "What we dream tonight, the world becomes tomorrow."
dreamweavers.ancestralMemory: The Dreamweavers learned to weave shared dreams ‚Äî a single night where an entire tribe dreams together ‚Äî and from those visions, they built their first city.

skyherders.name: Skyherders
skyherders.proverb: "From the heights, all borders are illusions."
skyherders.ancestralMemory: The Skyherders followed the great eagles to the roof of the world, where they discovered hidden valleys above the clouds and built the Sky Roads ‚Äî mountain paths only they can navigate.

reefbuilders.name: Reefbuilders
reefbuilders.proverb: "Build with the sea, not against it, and your walls will outlast stone."
reefbuilders.ancestralMemory: The Reefbuilders grew an entire island from living coral over seven generations ‚Äî a testament to patience and cooperation that stands to this day.

embersmiths.name: Embersmiths
embersmiths.proverb: "We do not fear the fire ‚Äî we are the fire."
embersmiths.ancestralMemory: The Embersmiths were born when a volcano's heart cracked open and their ancestors dared to reach inside, pulling out the first Everflame ‚Äî a fire that has never gone out.

marshborn.name: Marshborn
marshborn.proverb: "The swamp swallows the proud and shelters the humble."
marshborn.ancestralMemory: The Marshborn fled into the deepest bogs when invaders came, and the swamp hid them so well that their enemies believed them vanished. They have never left.

evolutionStages.name: Nomadic Band
evolutionStages.description: Small kinship groups wandering the land

evolutionStages.name: Tribal Camp
evolutionStages.description: Seasonal camps where tribes gather for trade and marriage

evolutionStages.name: Chiefdom
evolutionStages.description: A powerful chief unites several bands under one rule

evolutionStages.name: Village
evolutionStages.description: Settled communities with shared governance and craft specialization

evolutionStages.name: Town
evolutionStages.description: A thriving hub where multiple peoples have intermingled for generations

evolutionStages.name: City
evolutionStages.description: A great city where diverse subcultures form distinct quarters and guilds

evolutionStages.name: Metropolis
evolutionStages.description: A cosmopolitan center where cultures fuse into something new

FESTIVAL.name: Joint Festival
FESTIVAL.description: Celebrating together builds bonds across cultural lines

SHARED_DEFENSE.name: Shared Defense
SHARED_DEFENSE.description: Standing together against a common threat forges deep unity

RIVALRY.name: Cultural Rivalry
RIVALRY.description: Old grudges and competing traditions cause friction

CUISINE_FUSION.name: Cuisine Fusion
CUISINE_FUSION.description: Blending culinary traditions creates beloved new dishes

ART_EXCHANGE.name: Artistic Exchange
ART_EXCHANGE.description: Artists from different traditions inspire each other

KNOWLEDGE_SHARING.name: Knowledge Sharing
KNOWLEDGE_SHARING.description: Scholars and elders exchange ancient wisdom across cultural lines

BLOOD_FEUD.name: Blood Feud
BLOOD_FEUD.description: An ancient wrong festers into open hostility between peoples

MIGRATION.name: Migration
MIGRATION.description: A displaced people arrives, straining local resources and trust

SHARED_HARVEST.name: Shared Harvest
SHARED_HARVEST.description: Working the land together forges bonds of mutual dependence

LANGUAGE_BLEND.name: Language Blending
LANGUAGE_BLEND.description: Pidgin tongues and shared phrases emerge from daily contact

MYSTICAL_CONVERGENCE.name: Mystical Convergence
MYSTICAL_CONVERGENCE.description: A shared supernatural experience unites peoples in awe

FARM.name: Farm
FARM.description: Produces grain that can be milled or sold. Upkeep: 5g/day

MINE.name: Mine
MINE.description: Extracts valuable resources for sale. Upkeep: 15g/day

WORKSHOP.name: Workshop
WORKSHOP.description: Processes raw materials into goods. Upkeep: 10g/day

FISHING_WHARF.name: Fishing Wharf
FISHING_WHARF.description: Send boats to collect fish from nearby waters. Upkeep: 10g/day

BREWERY.name: Brewery
BREWERY.description: Brews beer from grain or distills liquor. Sells well at taverns. Upkeep: 8g/day

TAVERN.name: Tavern
TAVERN.description: A place for drink, gambling, and gossip. Earns gold daily from patrons. Upkeep: 12g/day

BEER.name: Brew Beer
BEER.description: Brew ale from grain. Popular at taverns.

LIQUOR.name: Distill Liquor
LIQUOR.description: Distill strong spirits from grain. High value.

MERCHANT_APPRENTICE.title: Merchant Apprentice
MERCHANT_APPRENTICE.description: Prove yourself as a trader by accumulating wealth.

TRADE_EMPIRE.title: Trade Empire
TRADE_EMPIRE.description: Build a network of profitable properties.

MERCENARY_CAPTAIN.title: Mercenary Captain
MERCENARY_CAPTAIN.description: Complete mercenary contracts to build your reputation.

PROPHET.title: Prophet
PROPHET.description: Found your own religion and spread the faith.

TEMPLE_BUILDER.title: Temple Builder
TEMPLE_BUILDER.description: Construct religious buildings to spread your faith.

WANDERER.title: Wanderer
WANDERER.description: Explore the world and discover new lands.

MARKET_MANIPULATOR.title: Market Manipulator
MARKET_MANIPULATOR.description: Buy low and sell high ‚Äî dominate the trade markets.

SILK_ROAD.title: The Silk Road
SILK_ROAD.description: Establish long-distance trade routes across the realm.

BANDIT_SLAYER.title: Bandit Slayer
BANDIT_SLAYER.description: Clear the roads of bandits and raiders.

HOLY_CRUSADER.title: Holy Crusader
HOLY_CRUSADER.description: Spread your faith through righteous combat.

MIRACLE_WORKER_QUEST.title: Miracle Worker
MIRACLE_WORKER_QUEST.description: Perform divine miracles to prove your devotion.

PILGRIMAGE.title: The Great Pilgrimage
PILGRIMAGE.description: Visit every holy site in the realm.

HERESY_HUNTER.title: Heresy Hunter
HERESY_HUNTER.description: Root out heretical movements threatening the faith.

TREASURE_HUNTER.title: Treasure Hunter
TREASURE_HUNTER.description: Find hidden treasures scattered across the realm.

MOUNTAIN_CLIMBER.title: Mountain Climber
MOUNTAIN_CLIMBER.description: Traverse the highest mountain peaks in the realm.

DIPLOMAT.title: Diplomat
DIPLOMAT.description: Establish diplomatic relations with multiple kingdoms.

KINGMAKER.title: Kingmaker
KINGMAKER.description: Become so influential you can sway the fate of kingdoms.

SPY_NETWORK.title: Spy Network
SPY_NETWORK.description: Build an intelligence network throughout the realm.

TAVERN_REGULAR.title: Tavern Regular
TAVERN_REGULAR.description: Become a well-known figure in the taverns of the realm.

SCHOLAR.title: Scholar
SCHOLAR.description: Research new technologies to advance your domain.

DRAGON_HUNTER.title: Dragon Hunter
DRAGON_HUNTER.description: Track and slay the legendary beasts terrorizing the land.

PEOPLES_CHAMPION.title: People's Champion
PEOPLES_CHAMPION.description: Help the common folk with their problems.

DIVINE_MANDATE.title: Divine Mandate
DIVINE_MANDATE.description: Become the supreme religious authority in the realm.

courtingStages.label: Strangers
courtingStages.description: You don't know each other yet.

chat.label: Have a Chat
chat.description: Strike up a conversation. Low reward, always available.

compliment.label: Give a Compliment
compliment.description: Offer a sincere compliment. Charisma helps.

gift.label: Give a Gift
gift.description: Buy a thoughtful gift. Costs gold.

moonlight_walk.label: Moonlight Walk
moonlight_walk.description: Take a quiet walk together to deepen connection.

romantic_dinner.label: Romantic Dinner
romantic_dinner.description: Invite them to a lavish dinner. Requires a settlement.

private_vows.label: Exchange Private Vows
private_vows.description: Pledge devotion in private before the wedding.

propose.label: Propose Marriage
propose.description: Ask for their hand in marriage. Must be deeply in love.

quality_time.label: Spend Quality Time
quality_time.description: Invest in your marriage and keep affection strong.

befriend.label: Be Friendly
befriend.description: Make small talk and build rapport.

share_meal.label: Share a Meal
share_meal.description: Break bread together. Costs a little gold.

tell_stories.label: Tell Stories
tell_stories.description: Share tales and listen to theirs.

train_together.label: Train Together
train_together.description: Spar or drill with this person. Builds respect.

confide_secret.label: Confide a Secret
confide_secret.description: Trust them with a private truth. Great reward if it lands.

blood_oath.label: Swear Blood Oath
blood_oath.description: Bind your loyalty in solemn ritual. Powerful, but risky.

challenge.label: Challenge to Duel
challenge.description: Challenge them to a friendly (or not) duel.

giftItems.name: Gold Ring
giftItems.description: A gleaming ring of fine gold.

giftItems.name: Fine Blade
giftItems.description: A well-forged weapon. Martial types appreciate this.

giftItems.name: Rare Book
giftItems.description: A book of knowledge or poetry.

npcCourtEvents.text: {npc} gives you a warm smile and says something flattering.
{npc} surprises you with a small gift ‚Äî a {item}.
{npc} seems jealous of someone you were talking to.
{npc} confides a personal story to you. You feel closer.
{npc} says something cutting about you in front of others.

marriageEvents.text: Your spouse {spouse} celebrates your anniversary with a special meal. üíï
{spouse} has fallen ill. You tend to them with care.
Your child {child} took their first steps today!

solaris.name: The Solar Covenant
solaris.description: Worship of the Eternal Sun ‚Äî the oldest surviving faith. Temples face east, and adherents mark holy days at dawn.

tidemother.name: Faith of the Tidemother
tidemother.description: Seafarers' faith centred on the Tidemother ‚Äî goddess of currents, storms, and safe harbour.

earthroot.name: The Earthroot Communion
earthroot.description: Nature worship venerating the world-tree whose roots bind all living things. Shrines stand in forest glades.

ironfaith.name: The Iron Creed
ironfaith.description: Born among mountain clans, the Iron Creed teaches that the soul is forged through trial and labour.

starseers.name: Order of the Starseers
starseers.description: Mystic scholar-monks who chart the heavens and claim to read fate in the constellations.

stoneheart.name: The Stoneheart Pact
stoneheart.description: Mountain-dwellers who believe the gods sleep inside stone and that every carved hall is a prayer.

serpentway.name: The Serpent's Way
serpentway.description: Swamp mystics who worship the Great Serpent ‚Äî symbol of death, rebirth, and the cycle of decay and renewal.

arcanum.name: The Arcane Orthodoxy
arcanum.description: Less a religion than a philosophical order ‚Äî practitioners believe magic itself is divine and study is worship.

stormfather.name: Cult of the Stormfather
stormfather.description: Northern raiders worship the Stormfather ‚Äî god of thunder, war, and the open sea. Sacrifices are made before raids.

dunewalkers.name: The Dunewalker Creed
dunewalkers.description: Desert faith teaching that the gods test mortals with heat and thirst. Water-sharing is the holiest act.

dreamweavers.name: The Dreamweaver Circle
dreamweavers.description: Practitioners enter dream-trances to commune with spirits. They believe waking life is the lesser reality.

ashwalkers.name: The Ashwalker Path
ashwalkers.description: Fire-worshippers who practised ritual immolation. Suppressed after the Great Pyre Rebellion of 230.

voidcallers.name: The Cult of the Void
voidcallers.description: An esoteric cult that worshipped the emptiness between stars. Banned after the Mindbreak Plague of 400.

bonesingers.name: The Bonesinger Rites
bonesingers.description: Ancestor-worship tradition where the dead were preserved and "sang" through wind-harps atop burial spires. Faded after prolonged plague.

flameheralds.name: Heralds of the Eternal Flame
flameheralds.description: A militant offshoot of the Solar Covenant. Launched three crusades before collapsing into internal schism.

bloodmoon.name: The Blood Moon Covenant
bloodmoon.description: Blood-sacrifice cult that performed rituals under the red moon. Eradicated by a combined crusade of the Solar Covenant and Iron Creed.

silentorder.name: The Silent Order
silentorder.description: Monks who took vows of eternal silence, believing all speech corrupted divine truth. Died out when no new followers could be recruited.

holySiteTypes.name: Sacred Spring
holySiteTypes.description: Blessed waters said to cure ailments

holySiteTypes.name: World-Tree Sapling
holySiteTypes.description: A sapling of the legendary world-tree

holySiteTypes.name: Grand Reliquary
holySiteTypes.description: Repository of sacred relics from many faiths

holySiteTypes.name: Dragon Bone Shrine
holySiteTypes.description: Shrine built around the petrified bones of an ancient dragon

holySiteTypes.name: Crystal Cavern
holySiteTypes.description: Underground cavern where crystals hum with divine resonance

holySiteTypes.name: Storm Peak Altar
holySiteTypes.description: Mountain summit where lightning strikes are divine omens

holySiteTypes.name: Sunken Temple
holySiteTypes.description: Half-submerged ruins of an ancient temple to forgotten gods

holySiteTypes.name: Oasis Shrine
holySiteTypes.description: Desert oasis believed to have been created by divine intervention

holySiteTypes.name: Moonwell
holySiteTypes.description: A still pool that reflects the stars even during daylight

holySiteTypes.name: The Blood Stone
holySiteTypes.description: A crimson megalith that seems to pulse with inner warmth

heresies.name: Dualist Heresy
heresies.description: Claims the divine has both a light and dark aspect, equal in power

heresies.name: Iconoclast Movement
heresies.description: Demands destruction of all religious imagery and relics

heresies.name: Free Prophet Schism
heresies.description: Anyone may declare prophecy ‚Äî no central authority

heresies.name: Ascetic Revolt
heresies.description: Extreme poverty movement rejecting all temple wealth

heresies.name: Blood Rite Revival
heresies.description: Attempts to revive forbidden sacrificial practices

heresies.name: Wild Faith
heresies.description: Rejects all temples and structure ‚Äî worship only in the untamed wild

heresies.name: Mechanist Doctrine
heresies.description: Claims the divine is a great machine and prayer is merely engineering

heresies.name: Ancestor Revival
heresies.description: Bonesinger rites resurface ‚Äî the dead should guide the living

heresies.name: Void Whisper
heresies.description: Secretive resurgence of Void worship, promising forbidden knowledge

heresies.name: Sun-Moon Schism
heresies.description: Solar Covenant splits over whether the moon is the sun's equal or enemy

heresies.name: Living God Movement
heresies.description: A charismatic preacher claims to be a god incarnate

SHRINE.name: Shrine
SHRINE.description: Small place of worship, spreads faith locally

MONASTERY.name: Monastery
MONASTERY.description: Peaceful retreat, generates karma and faith

CATHEDRAL.name: Cathedral
CATHEDRAL.description: Magnificent cathedral, the pinnacle of religious architecture

ORACLE_TOWER.name: Oracle Tower
ORACLE_TOWER.description: A tower where oracles divine the future through ritual and stargazing

PILGRIM_HOSPICE.name: Pilgrim Hospice
PILGRIM_HOSPICE.description: A waystation offering shelter and healing to pilgrims

SACRED_GROVE.name: Sacred Grove
SACRED_GROVE.description: A consecrated woodland clearing for nature worship

RELIQUARY_VAULT.name: Reliquary Vault
RELIQUARY_VAULT.description: A fortified vault housing powerful religious relics

HEALING.name: Divine Healing
HEALING.description: Invoke divine power to heal all wounds

CONVERSION.name: Mass Conversion
CONVERSION.description: Convert many to your faith at once

HARVEST.name: Bountiful Harvest
HARVEST.effect: All farms produce triple for 3 days
HARVEST.description: Invoke divine fertility upon the land

SMITE.name: Divine Smite
SMITE.effect: Deal massive damage to an enemy unit
SMITE.description: Call down divine wrath upon your enemies

REVELATION.name: Revelation
REVELATION.effect: Reveal all tiles in a large radius
REVELATION.description: The divine grants sight beyond mortal ken

SANCTUARY.name: Holy Sanctuary
SANCTUARY.effect: Create a safe zone where no combat can occur for 5 days
SANCTUARY.description: Consecrate the ground so no blood may be shed upon it

RESURRECTION.name: Resurrection
RESURRECTION.effect: Restore a destroyed unit to full strength
RESURRECTION.description: Call the fallen back from beyond the veil

PLAGUE.name: Divine Plague
PLAGUE.description: Unleash a terrible pestilence upon the unfaithful

shipTypes.name: Rowboat
shipTypes.description: A simple wooden rowboat. Slow and vulnerable, but affordable for beginners.

shipTypes.name: Fishing Vessel
shipTypes.description: A sturdy coastal fishing boat. Can handle shallow waters and bring in a catch.

shipTypes.name: Sloop
shipTypes.description: A fast single-masted vessel. Excellent for coastal trading and light combat.

shipTypes.name: Trading Cog
shipTypes.description: A broad-beamed merchant ship built for carrying large cargoes across open seas.

shipTypes.name: Caravel
shipTypes.description: A nimble exploration vessel with lateen sails. Perfect for discovering new lands.

shipTypes.name: War Galley
shipTypes.description: An oar-driven warship built for ram-and-board tactics. Dominates coastal waters.

shipTypes.name: Galleon
shipTypes.description: A massive multi-decked vessel. The queen of the seas ‚Äî formidable in both trade and war.

customizations.name: Reinforced Hull
customizations.description: Thicker planking and iron bracing to withstand heavy seas and combat.

customizations.name: Extra Sails
customizations.description: Additional sail area for greater speed in favorable winds.

customizations.name: Expanded Cargo Hold
customizations.description: Redesigned hull interior to maximize storage capacity.

customizations.name: Bronze Ram
customizations.description: A reinforced prow for devastating ramming attacks.

customizations.name: Deck Ballista
customizations.description: A mounted siege weapon for ranged naval combat.

customizations.name: Boarding Planks
customizations.description: Drop-bridges for boarding enemy vessels. Improves capture chances.

customizations.name: Navigator's Quarters
customizations.description: Dedicated quarters with charts and instruments. Improves exploration.

customizations.name: Crow's Nest
customizations.description: A high lookout point for spotting land, ships, and danger.

customizations.name: Greek Fire Siphon
customizations.description: A devastating incendiary weapon that can set enemy ships ablaze.

customizations.name: Captain's Luxury Cabin
customizations.description: Opulent quarters that demonstrate your wealth and status.

customizations.name: Improved Oars
customizations.description: Better-crafted oars for improved speed and handling.

customizations.name: Deep-Sea Nets
customizations.description: Professional-grade nets for catching larger hauls.

usedShipDescriptions: Seen better days, but still seaworthy
A salvaged ship, repaired and ready
Previous owner was lost at sea
Impounded by the harbormaster ‚Äî now for sale
Abandoned and reclaimed from a sandbar

explorationEvents.name: Floating Cargo
explorationEvents.description: You discover drifting crates from a shipwreck.

explorationEvents.name: Uncharted Island
explorationEvents.description: You spot a small island not on any charts. Landing reveals hidden treasures.

explorationEvents.name: Whale Sighting
explorationEvents.description: A magnificent whale breaches near your ship. The crew takes it as a good omen.

explorationEvents.name: Sea Monster!
explorationEvents.description: A tentacled beast rises from the deep and attacks your ship!

explorationEvents.name: Stranded Sailors
explorationEvents.description: You find shipwrecked sailors clinging to debris. Rescue them for karma and information.

explorationEvents.name: Merchant Wreck
explorationEvents.description: The remains of a merchant vessel with salvageable goods.

explorationEvents.name: Calm Seas
explorationEvents.description: Beautiful weather and smooth sailing. Your crew's morale improves.

explorationEvents.name: Sudden Storm
explorationEvents.description: A fierce storm batters your ship. Hold fast!

explorationEvents.name: Pirate Ambush!
explorationEvents.description: Pirates emerge from behind a rocky outcrop!

explorationEvents.name: Dolphins
explorationEvents.description: A pod of dolphins escorts your ship. Sailors say it means good luck.

farm.description: A dedicated space for agricultural experiments and crop research.

workshop.description: An advanced facility for engineering, metallurgy, and military research.

trading_post.description: A school of commerce, economics, and trade strategy.

harbor.description: A dedicated facility for naval engineering and seamanship research.

library.description: A great hall of study for cultural and educational advancement.

apothecary.description: A facility for researching herbal remedies, surgery, and disease prevention.

CROP_ROTATION.name: Crop Rotation
CROP_ROTATION.description: Rotating crops across fields restores soil nutrients and improves yields.
CROP_ROTATION.flavorText: The land gives more when you give it time to breathe.

IRRIGATION.name: Irrigation Systems
IRRIGATION.description: Channel water to fields for consistent irrigation.

SELECTIVE_BREEDING.name: Selective Breeding
SELECTIVE_BREEDING.description: Breed stronger livestock for better wool and meat.
SELECTIVE_BREEDING.flavorText: Nature perfected through patience and observation.

FERTILIZATION.name: Advanced Fertilization
FERTILIZATION.description: Use composting and manure techniques to dramatically boost farm output.
FERTILIZATION.flavorText: From waste, abundance. The circle of the field is complete.

GRANARY_CONSTRUCTION.name: Granary Construction
GRANARY_CONSTRUCTION.description: Build granaries to store surplus grain and prevent spoilage.
GRANARY_CONSTRUCTION.flavorText: Seven years of plenty shall sustain seven years of famine.

IMPROVED_TOOLS.name: Improved Tools
IMPROVED_TOOLS.description: Better-forged tools increase mining and logging efficiency.
IMPROVED_TOOLS.flavorText: A sharp axe makes light work.

ADVANCED_SMELTING.name: Advanced Smelting
ADVANCED_SMELTING.flavorText: In the heart of the forge, impurities burn away.

WATER_MILL.name: Water Mill
WATER_MILL.description: Harness water power to automate milling and sawing.
WATER_MILL.flavorText: The river works tirelessly so we don't have to.

STONECUTTING.name: Stonecutting
STONECUTTING.description: Cut and shape stone for stronger construction.
STONECUTTING.flavorText: From rough rock, we carve the foundations of empire.

STEEL_FORGING.name: Steel Forging
STEEL_FORGING.description: Forge weapons and armor of superior steel.
STEEL_FORGING.flavorText: Steel that sings when drawn ‚Äî a craftsman's pride.

BASIC_TRAINING.name: Basic Training
BASIC_TRAINING.description: Organized militia training for better combat performance.
BASIC_TRAINING.flavorText: Even farmers fight better when they know which end of the sword to hold.

ARCHERY_MASTERY.name: Archery Mastery
ARCHERY_MASTERY.description: Advanced bow techniques for deadlier ranged attacks.
ARCHERY_MASTERY.flavorText: Their arrows blot out the sun.

CAVALRY_TACTICS.name: Cavalry Tactics
CAVALRY_TACTICS.description: Mounted combat formations and flanking maneuvers.
CAVALRY_TACTICS.flavorText: A thundering charge to break any shield wall.

SIEGE_ENGINEERING.name: Siege Engineering
SIEGE_ENGINEERING.description: Build siege engines to assault fortified positions.
SIEGE_ENGINEERING.flavorText: No wall can stand against the relentless pounding.

FORTIFICATION.name: Fortification
FORTIFICATION.description: Build defensive walls and watchtowers for your settlements.
FORTIFICATION.flavorText: These walls shall be our unyielding shield.

ROAD_BUILDING.name: Road Building
ROAD_BUILDING.description: Construct dirt roads between hexes to speed travel.
ROAD_BUILDING.flavorText: All great journeys begin with a well-trodden path.

PAVED_ROADS.name: Paved Roads
PAVED_ROADS.description: Stone-paved roads for even faster travel.
PAVED_ROADS.flavorText: Rome endured because its roads did.

BRIDGE_CONSTRUCTION.name: Bridge Construction
BRIDGE_CONSTRUCTION.description: Build bridges to cross rivers and reduce swamp penalties.
BRIDGE_CONSTRUCTION.flavorText: Where rivers once stopped us, bridges carry us onward.

CARTOGRAPHY.name: Cartography
CARTOGRAPHY.description: Map the land to reveal more territory and plan better routes.
CARTOGRAPHY.flavorText: With knowledge of the land comes mastery over it.

AQUEDUCTS.name: Aqueducts
AQUEDUCTS.description: Monumental water channels that boost settlement growth.
AQUEDUCTS.flavorText: Water flows uphill when engineers will it so.

BASIC_ACCOUNTING.name: Basic Accounting
BASIC_ACCOUNTING.description: Better bookkeeping means lower trade losses.
BASIC_ACCOUNTING.flavorText: A lord who knows his ledger commands more than gold.

TRADE_NETWORKS.name: Trade Networks
TRADE_NETWORKS.description: Establish trade routes for higher caravan profits.
TRADE_NETWORKS.flavorText: Connections forged in gold last longer than those in iron.

CURRENCY_MINTING.name: Currency Minting
CURRENCY_MINTING.description: Mint your own coins for more favorable trade terms.
CURRENCY_MINTING.flavorText: A coin with your likeness commands respect in any market.

MERCHANT_GUILD.name: Merchant Guild
MERCHANT_GUILD.description: Found a merchant guild for powerful economic bonuses.
MERCHANT_GUILD.flavorText: United merchants shape the fate of kingdoms.

BANKING_SYSTEMS.name: Banking Systems
BANKING_SYSTEMS.description: Advanced financial institutions and investment returns.
BANKING_SYSTEMS.flavorText: Let money beget money, and prosperity shall follow.

SHIPBUILDING.name: Shipbuilding
SHIPBUILDING.description: Construct seaworthy vessels for trade and exploration.
SHIPBUILDING.flavorText: The first plank laid is a promise to the sea.

NAVIGATION.name: Navigation
NAVIGATION.description: Star charts and compass enable long-distance sea voyages.
NAVIGATION.flavorText: By star and compass, the unknown becomes a road.

DEEP_SEA_FISHING.name: Deep Sea Fishing
DEEP_SEA_FISHING.description: Venture into deep waters for bountiful catches.
DEEP_SEA_FISHING.flavorText: The deep waters teem with silver bounty.

NAVAL_WARFARE.name: Naval Warfare
NAVAL_WARFARE.description: Train marines and outfit warships for sea battles.
NAVAL_WARFARE.flavorText: Command the seas, and the land shall kneel.

LIGHTHOUSE.name: Lighthouse
LIGHTHOUSE.description: Build coastal lighthouses to protect shipping and boost port trade.
LIGHTHOUSE.flavorText: A single flame on the shore saves a thousand souls at sea.

HERBALISM.name: Herbalism
HERBALISM.description: Identify and cultivate medicinal plants for basic remedies.
HERBALISM.flavorText: The forest is the oldest apothecary.

SURGERY.name: Surgery
SURGERY.description: Skilled surgeons can save wounded soldiers and treat injuries.
SURGERY.flavorText: A steady hand and a sharp blade ‚Äî the surgeon's arts.

PLAGUE_PREVENTION.name: Plague Prevention
PLAGUE_PREVENTION.description: Quarantine protocols and sanitation reduce disease spread.
PLAGUE_PREVENTION.flavorText: Cleanliness wards off death more surely than any sword.

HOSPITAL.name: Hospital
HOSPITAL.description: Establish hospitals for comprehensive healthcare in settlements.
HOSPITAL.flavorText: Where the sick are tended, civilisation endures.

WRITING.name: Writing
WRITING.description: Develop a writing system for record-keeping and knowledge preservation.
WRITING.flavorText: With marks on clay, we conquered time itself.

PHILOSOPHY.name: Philosophy
PHILOSOPHY.description: Schools of thought that enrich culture and governance.
PHILOSOPHY.flavorText: The unexamined realm is not worth ruling.

DIPLOMACY_MASTERY.name: Diplomacy Mastery
DIPLOMACY_MASTERY.description: Advanced diplomatic techniques for treaties and alliances.
DIPLOMACY_MASTERY.flavorText: Words, well placed, can accomplish what armies cannot.

UNIVERSITY.name: University
UNIVERSITY.description: Found a great university to accelerate all research.
UNIVERSITY.flavorText: Knowledge multiplies when minds gather under one roof.

PRINTING_PRESS.name: Printing Press
PRINTING_PRESS.description: Mass-produce books and spread literacy across the realm.
PRINTING_PRESS.flavorText: A single press can topple empires ‚Äî or build them.

ESPIONAGE.name: Espionage
ESPIONAGE.description: Train spies and establish intelligence networks.
ESPIONAGE.flavorText: The truest weapon is the one your enemy never sees.

HEAVY_CAVALRY.name: Heavy Cavalry
HEAVY_CAVALRY.description: Armored knights on warhorses ‚Äî the ultimate shock force.

PLATE_ARMOR.name: Plate Armor
PLATE_ARMOR.description: Full plate armor provides extraordinary protection.
PLATE_ARMOR.flavorText: Encased in steel, a single knight becomes a fortress.

CROSSBOW.name: Crossbow
CROSSBOW.description: Mechanical bows that penetrate heavy armor.
CROSSBOW.flavorText: Even a peasant with a crossbow can fell a knight.

WINDMILL.name: Windmill
WINDMILL.description: Harness wind power for grinding grain and pumping water.
WINDMILL.flavorText: What the wind gives freely, the wise put to work.

GLASSMAKING.name: Glassmaking
GLASSMAKING.description: Produce glass for windows, lenses, and trade goods.
GLASSMAKING.flavorText: From sand, something wondrous ‚Äî clear as water, hard as stone.

DEEP_MINING.name: Deep Mining
DEEP_MINING.description: Mine deeper veins for rare ores and gems.
DEEP_MINING.flavorText: The deeper we dig, the richer the earth becomes.

IRRIGATED_FARM.name: Irrigated Farm
IRRIGATED_FARM.description: Irrigated farmland produces abundant grain even in arid regions. Upkeep: 8g/day

GRANARY.name: Granary
GRANARY.description: Stores surplus grain and prevents spoilage. Doubles property storage. Upkeep: 3g/day

FOUNDRY.name: Foundry
FOUNDRY.description: Advanced metalworking facility. Produces refined metals. Upkeep: 20g/day

WATER_MILL.name: Water Mill
WATER_MILL.description: Water-powered mill for automated processing. +30% workshop output. Upkeep: 8g/day

QUARRY.name: Quarry
QUARRY.description: Extracts building stone from the earth. Upkeep: 12g/day

WATCHTOWER.name: Watchtower
WATCHTOWER.description: Guards the surrounding area and extends vision. Upkeep: 5g/day

MERCHANT_GUILD.name: Merchant Guild
MERCHANT_GUILD.description: A guild hall that boosts all trade profits. Upkeep: 15g/day

SHIPYARD.name: Shipyard
SHIPYARD.description: Builds and repairs ships for trade and war. Upkeep: 12g/day

FISHING_FLEET.name: Fishing Fleet
FISHING_FLEET.description: A fleet of fishing boats harvesting the deep sea. Upkeep: 8g/day

LIGHTHOUSE.name: Lighthouse
LIGHTHOUSE.description: Guides ships safely and boosts port trade revenue. Upkeep: 5g/day

HOSPITAL.name: Hospital
HOSPITAL.description: Treats the sick and wounded, boosting population growth. Upkeep: 10g/day

UNIVERSITY.name: University
UNIVERSITY.description: A center of higher learning that accelerates all research. Upkeep: 18g/day

WINDMILL.name: Windmill
WINDMILL.description: Wind-powered mill for grain processing and water pumping. Upkeep: 5g/day

LONGBOWMAN.name: Longbowman
LONGBOWMAN.description: Elite ranged unit with devastating volleys

CAVALRY.name: Light Cavalry
CAVALRY.description: Fast mounted units, excellent for flanking and pursuit

SIEGE_ENGINE.name: Siege Engine
SIEGE_ENGINE.description: Devastating siege weapons for assaulting fortifications

WARSHIP.name: Warship
WARSHIP.description: Armed vessel for naval combat and coastal raids

HEAVY_CAVALRY.name: Heavy Cavalry
HEAVY_CAVALRY.description: Heavily armored mounted knights ‚Äî devastating shock troops

CROSSBOWMAN.name: Crossbowman
CROSSBOWMAN.description: Armored ranged unit with armor-piercing bolts

STEEL_WEAPONS.name: Forge Steel Weapons
STEEL_WEAPONS.description: Forge superior steel weapons worth more.

STEEL_ARMOR.name: Forge Steel Armor
STEEL_ARMOR.description: Forge protective steel armor and equipment.

PLATE_ARMOR_SET.name: Forge Plate Armor
PLATE_ARMOR_SET.description: Craft full suits of plate armor for elite warriors.

GLASS_GOODS.name: Produce Glass Goods
GLASS_GOODS.description: Craft valuable glass items for trade and construction.

tax_collector.name: Tax Collector
tax_collector.description: You are charged with visiting settlements and collecting taxes on behalf of the crown. A thankless but lucrative office.

duties.description: Visit at least 3 kingdom settlements and collect taxes each month.

jailer.name: Jailer
jailer.description: You are the keeper of the kingdom's dungeons. Hunt fugitives, capture criminals, and deliver them to the nearest jail.

duties.description: Capture at least 1 fugitive and bring them to justice each month.

marshal.name: Marshal
marshal.description: Commander of the kingdom's military patrols. Defend the realm, clear bandits from the roads, and escort caravans.

duties.description: Complete at least 4 patrols through kingdom territory each month.

spymaster.name: Spymaster
spymaster.description: Master of whispers and shadows. Gather intelligence on rival kingdoms, uncover plots, and manage the kingdom's informant network.

duties.description: Gather at least 2 pieces of foreign intelligence each month.

court_chaplain.name: Court Chaplain
court_chaplain.description: Spiritual advisor to the court. Tend to the kingdom's faith, bless the people, and maintain holy sites.

duties.description: Visit and bless at least 2 kingdom settlements each month.

trade_envoy.name: Trade Envoy
trade_envoy.description: Official representative of the kingdom's trade interests. Negotiate deals, establish trade routes, and bring prosperity.

duties.description: Complete at least 2 trade missions to foreign kingdoms each month.

royal_cartographer.name: Royal Cartographer
royal_cartographer.description: Official mapmaker of the realm. Explore uncharted territory, survey borders, and expand the kingdom's knowledge of the world.

duties.description: Explore and survey at least 20 new tiles each month.

chancellor.name: Chancellor
chancellor.description: Chief advisor to the ruler and overseer of the kingdom's affairs. The highest non-royal office, with authority over all other officials.

duties.description: Hold court at the capital and maintain kingdom stability each month.

DROUGHT.name: Severe Drought
DROUGHT.description: A prolonged drought scorches the land, devastating crops and drying rivers.
DROUGHT.text: A terrible drought grips {region}. Crops wither and wells run dry.

PLAGUE.name: Plague Outbreak
PLAGUE.description: A devastating plague sweeps through settlements, killing thousands.
PLAGUE.text: Plague has broken out in {settlement}! The dead are piling up in the streets.

FLOOD.name: Great Flood
FLOOD.description: Rivers burst their banks, flooding farmland and washing away roads.
FLOOD.text: Devastating floods ravage the lowlands near {settlement}.

EARTHQUAKE.name: Earthquake
EARTHQUAKE.description: The earth shakes violently, toppling buildings and opening fissures.
EARTHQUAKE.text: A mighty earthquake strikes near {settlement}! Buildings crumble and the earth splits.

BOUNTIFUL_HARVEST.name: Bountiful Harvest
BOUNTIFUL_HARVEST.description: Ideal weather conditions produce a bumper harvest across the realm.
BOUNTIFUL_HARVEST.text: The harvest in {region} is the best in living memory! Granaries overflow.

GOLD_RUSH.name: Gold Rush
GOLD_RUSH.description: Rich gold deposits are discovered, drawing prospectors from across the realm.
GOLD_RUSH.text: Gold has been discovered near {settlement}! Prospectors flood into the region.

TRADE_BOOM.name: Trade Boom
TRADE_BOOM.description: A flourishing period of trade enriches merchants and kingdoms alike.
TRADE_BOOM.text: Trade flourishes across {region}. Merchants report record profits.

MARKET_CRASH.name: Market Crash
MARKET_CRASH.description: A sudden collapse in trade confidence sends markets into freefall.
MARKET_CRASH.text: Markets crash across {region}! Merchants are ruined and prices plummet.

PIRATE_SURGE.name: Pirate Surge
PIRATE_SURGE.description: Pirates grow bold and numerous, threatening coastal trade.
PIRATE_SURGE.text: Pirates terrorize the shipping lanes near {settlement}. Sea trade grinds to a halt.

BANDIT_UPRISING.name: Bandit Uprising
BANDIT_UPRISING.description: Organized bandit gangs terrorize the countryside.
BANDIT_UPRISING.text: Bandits have formed an organized gang near {settlement}. The roads are unsafe.

KINGDOM_WAR.name: Kingdom War
KINGDOM_WAR.description: Two kingdoms go to war, dragging their neighbors into the conflict.
KINGDOM_WAR.text: {kingdom1} declares war on {kingdom2}! Armies march to battle.

REBELLION.name: Peasant Rebellion
REBELLION.description: Oppressed peasants rise up against their lords.
REBELLION.text: The peasants of {settlement} have risen in rebellion against {kingdom}!

SUCCESSION_CRISIS.name: Succession Crisis
SUCCESSION_CRISIS.description: The death of a ruler without a clear heir throws a kingdom into turmoil.
SUCCESSION_CRISIS.text: The ruler of {kingdom} has died without a clear heir. Rival claimants vie for the throne.

DIPLOMATIC_MARRIAGE.name: Royal Wedding
DIPLOMATIC_MARRIAGE.description: A royal marriage unites two houses and eases tensions between kingdoms.
DIPLOMATIC_MARRIAGE.text: A grand wedding celebration! {kingdom1} and {kingdom2} forge an alliance through marriage.

RELIGIOUS_SCHISM.name: Religious Schism
RELIGIOUS_SCHISM.description: A major split within a faith divides believers and sows discord.
RELIGIOUS_SCHISM.text: A schism erupts within the {faith}! Believers are forced to choose sides.

HOLY_CRUSADE.name: Holy Crusade
HOLY_CRUSADE.description: Religious leaders call for a holy war to reclaim sacred territory.
HOLY_CRUSADE.text: A crusade is declared! The faithful rally to reclaim the holy lands.

COMET_SIGHTING.name: Comet Sighting
COMET_SIGHTING.description: A blazing comet streaks across the sky. Some see it as a blessing, others a curse.
COMET_SIGHTING.text: A comet appears in the night sky! Priests debate its meaning while the commoners tremble.

ECLIPSE.name: Solar Eclipse
ECLIPSE.description: The sun goes dark in the middle of the day, spreading fear and awe.
ECLIPSE.text: The sun is swallowed by darkness! An eclipse throws the realm into momentary panic.

MONSTER_SIGHTING.name: Monster Sighting
MONSTER_SIGHTING.description: A fearsome creature is sighted in the wilds, threatening travelers and settlements.
MONSTER_SIGHTING.text: A terrible beast has been sighted near {settlement}! Brave warriors are needed.

FESTIVAL.name: Grand Festival
FESTIVAL.description: A grand celebration brings joy and commerce to the realm.
FESTIVAL.text: {kingdom} celebrates a grand festival! Music, food, and merriment fill the streets.

REFUGEE_WAVE.name: Refugee Wave
REFUGEE_WAVE.description: War or disaster drives refugees to seek shelter in neighboring kingdoms.
REFUGEE_WAVE.text: Refugees pour into {settlement}, fleeing turmoil. They bring labor but strain resources.

VOLCANIC_ERUPTION.name: Volcanic Eruption
VOLCANIC_ERUPTION.description: A volcano erupts, raining ash and fire upon the surrounding lands.
VOLCANIC_ERUPTION.text: A volcano erupts with cataclysmic fury! Ash blots out the sun across {region}.

BLIZZARD.name: Great Blizzard
BLIZZARD.description: An unseasonably fierce blizzard blankets the land in deep snow.
BLIZZARD.text: A terrible blizzard sweeps across {region}. Roads are impassable and livestock freeze.

meta.description: LPC terrain spritesheet ‚Äî tile classification and mapping
meta.note: The terrain sheets are 512x832 = 16cols x 26rows of 32x32 tiles. Tiles are organized into autotile transition groups. This file separates FILL tiles (uniform solid ground) from EDGE tiles (transition/corner tiles that blend two terrains). Only tiles in 'fills' should be used for ground rendering.

_note: Documents the spritesheet's autotile transition groups.
Each terrain type occupies a 6-col x 3-row block:
Additional 3x3 blocks at cols 6-8, 9-11 are TRANSITION BLENDS
between two terrain types ‚Äî these contain mixed-color edge tiles.
The center tile of a transition blend IS the target terrain fill.
FILL  = fully opaque, uniform color (stddev < 8) ‚Äî safe for ground
TXTR  = fully opaque, textured (stddev >= 8) ‚Äî may be fill or edge
TRANS = partially transparent ‚Äî definitely an edge/overlay tile

groups.name: grass
groups.description: Grass autotile. Outer edges at cols 0-2 (all TRANS). Inner corners at [0,3-5] (TRANS). Fill variants at [1,3-5] (TXTR grass-colored) and [2,3-5] (FILL). Center fill at [1,1].

groups.name: grass_dirt_transition
groups.description: Grass-to-dirt transition edges. ALL tiles are TXTR with blended green+brown colors. No fills ‚Äî edge-only.

groups.name: grass_sand_transition
groups.description: Grass-to-sand transition edges. Center [1,10] is FILL sand. Corner tiles [0,9],[0,11],[2,9],[2,11] are TXTR with blended sand+green ‚Äî NOT dirt fills despite brownish color.

groups.name: dirt
groups.description: Dirt autotile. Outer edges at cols 0-2 (TRANS). [4,1] is EMPTY (inverse center). Fills at [3,3-5] and [4,3-5] (all FILL dirt).

groups.name: sand
groups.description: Sand autotile row. Edges at cols 0-2 (TRANS). Fills at [5,3-5] (FILL sand).

groups.name: dirt_sand_transitions
groups.description: Dirt/sand transition edges. ALL tiles TXTR with blended colors. No usable fills.

groups.name: dry_dirt
groups.description: Dry dirt/clay autotile. Edges at cols 0-2 (TRANS). Fills at [6,3],[6,4] (FILL). Rows 7-9 cols 3-5 are EMPTY.

groups.name: dry_dirt_transitions
groups.description: Dry dirt transition blocks. Center fills at [6,10] (FILL) and [9,9],[9,10] (FILL). Tiles at [8,9],[8,10] are TXTR edges ‚Äî NOT fills despite similar color.

groups.name: water_group_1
groups.description: Water autotile transition blocks (4 x 3x3 blocks). Center fills at [11,1] (FILL water). [11,4] is EMPTY (inverse). All other tiles are TXTR transitions blending water with grass/other.

groups.name: water_group_2
groups.description: Additional water transition blocks. Multiple 3x3 groups. No additional verified fills in this area.

groups.name: stone_fills
groups.description: Stone and dark stone fill block. 4x4 grid of textured but uniform fills. Rows 12,15 = lighter stone (~101,113,100). Rows 13,14 = darker stone (~97,107,97). All TXTR but same-terrain throughout ‚Äî safe to use as fills.

groups.name: water_fill_block
groups.description: Water fill block. All 8 tiles are verified FILL (~42,132,151). Uniform shallow water.

groups.name: water_group_3
groups.description: More water transition variants. Center fill at [21,1] (FILL water). All others are TXTR transitions.

groups.name: deep_water
groups.description: Deep water autotile transitions. Only [24,1] is FILL (~23,58,85). Multiple 3x3 transition blocks span cols 0-2, 5-7, 10-12. Tiles at cols 3-4, 8-9, 13-14 are TXTR edges with shifted colors (25-28,63-82,90-113) ‚Äî NOT fills.

fills._note: Each entry lists ONLY tiles verified as solid uniform fills (FILL) or same-color textured fills. NO edge, corner, or transition tiles. Pixel coords = col*32, row*32.

rejectedTiles._note: Tiles previously listed as fills that are actually edge/transition tiles. Documented here to prevent re-adding them.
